content.tag-cloud-info: The word cloud in »frag.jetzt« serves as a semantic filter: the larger the font, the more often the word was used grammatically in the questions or assigned as a keyword. The ratings of the questions also influence the font size.

deepl.label: Which text to send?
deepl.no-optimization: The text does not need improvement.

deepl-formality-select.error: The text could not be updated.
deepl-formality-select.name: Style

explanation.label: Explain
explanation.deepl:
## Text optimization

To make your question as readable and understandable as possible, we have it translated into German and back into English using the translation program [DeepL](https://www.deepl.com/translator).

The back translation is in almost all cases better than the original in terms of spelling, grammar, punctuation and language style. Back translation can be done in two ways: informally or formally.
explanation.spacy:
## Text analysis

Using NLP (Natural Language Processing) your question will be analyzed grammatically. The recognized nouns are put into their basic form, i.e. lemmatized, and suggested to you as keywords. For the text analysis we use the free NLP software [spaCy](https://spacy.io/). 

The keywords can be used to filter the list of questions or to create a word cloud.
explanation.topic-cloud:
## Topic cloud

The topic cloud visualizes the distribution of the keywords. These were determined by grammatical analysis of the nouns in the question text or explicitly assigned to the question by the author. 

 The calculation of the font size includes:

* the difference between up- and down-votes, if it is positive
* the number of questions with this keyword
* the number of questioners with this keyword.
* the role of the questioner: room creator, moderator or participant 
* whether the questioner has selected a question category
* whether the keyword was generated or assigned by the question poser
* whether the question was answered by the room creator or a moderator
* the controversy of the question  

 The topic cloud serves as a **navigator** to all questions related to a selected keyword: If you click on a word in the cloud, you will get to the questions related to this keyword. 

The room creator can customize the appearance of the topic cloud in the options according to his wishes. He can also experiment with the keyword generation parameters to optimize the **semantic selectivity**.
explanation.user-bonus:
## Bonus 

The teacher can mark »good« questions for a bonus. Your questions from all courses (rooms) that have received a star will be listed here.

Depending on the agreement, you can email the token of the star to the teacher to redeem it for a bonus.
explanation.bonus-archive:
## Bonus Archive 

All questions that you have marked with a star in your rooms are listed here. You can use the list to check whether the token that a participant sent you by mail is valid. 

To find a token quickly, there is a search field. If the token is valid, you can display the corresponding question directly via a link.
explanation.brainstorming:
## Brainstorming 

When creating a brainstorming session, the room creator or a moderator sets the topic of the brainstorming session and determines the maximum total number of words and characters per entry.

Each entry in the word cloud can be voted on. To do this, hover over the entry and click on a voting icon in the associated pop-up window.

In the Q&A list, all brainstorming entries can be displayed with the corresponding filter. If the author has entered his name when creating the entry, it will be visible on the entry.
explanation.add-moderators:
## Moderators 

Guest and permanent moderators have the same rights as the creator of the room. But they can't delete questions or the whole room. 

Everyone can be added as a **permanent moderator** with their **mail address** with which they registered at »frag.jetzt«. 

An unregistered user can become a **guest moderator** by entering the room via **direct link** or 8-digit **access code**.
